Class readAndWriteFiles

  • java.lang.Object
    • readAndWriteFiles

  • public class readAndWriteFiles
extends java.lang.Object
    This class groups all the methods that read or write data to the person.txt, projects.txt and CompletedProject.txt files.

    The class also includes methods that convert Arrays and ArrayLists so that the data is usable for following steps.

    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Nadia Botha

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      readAndWriteFiles()

      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static java.lang.String[] convertPersonArrayToString(java.util.ArrayList<Person> allPersonsDetails)
      This method converts a Person ArrayList to a String Array so that it can be written to the person.txt file.
      static java.lang.String[] convertProjectArrayToStringArray(Project[] allProjectDetailsArray)
      Converts a Project Array to a String Array, so that it can be written to the projects.txt text file.
      static Project[] convertStringArrayListToProjectArray(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> allProjectsDetails)
      This method converts a String ArrayList to a Project Array.
      static java.util.ArrayList<Person> convertStringToPersonArray(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> allPersonsDetailsString)
      This method converts a String ArrayList to a Person ArrayList.
      static void createCompletedProjectFile()
      This method creates an empty text file called CompletedProject.txt where all the Project object details are stored permanently, for projects that have been finalized.
      static void createPersonFile()
      This method creates an empty text file called person.txt where all the Person object details are stored permanently.
      static void createProjectFile()
      This method creates an empty text file called projects.txt where all the Project object details are stored permanently.
      static java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> readInputAndSavePersonArrayString()
      This method reads the person.txt file saves each line as an array entry in a String ArrayList.
      static java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> readInputAndSaveProjectArray()
      This method reads the project.txt file saves each line as an array entry in a String ArrayList.
      static void writeUpdatedInfoToCompletedProjectTextFile(java.lang.String[] completedProjectsArray)
      This method writes Project String Arrays to the CompletedProject.txt file.
      static void writeUpdatedInfoToPersonTextFile(java.lang.String[] personDetailsToPrint)
      This method writes person String Arrays to the person.txt file.
      static void writeUpdatedInfoToProjectTextFile(java.lang.String[] projectDetailsArray)
      This method writes project String Arrays to the projects.txt file.

      • readAndWriteFiles

        public readAndWriteFiles()

    • Method Detail

      • createProjectFile

        public static void createProjectFile()
        This method creates an empty text file called projects.txt where all the Project object details are stored permanently.

        If the text file already exists, nothing is done. If the text file does not exist and cannot be created an error message is displays.

        See Also:
        ../projects.txt

      • createPersonFile

        public static void createPersonFile()
        This method creates an empty text file called person.txt where all the Person object details are stored permanently.

        If the text file already exists, nothing is done. If the text file does not exist and cannot be created an error message is displays

        See Also:
        ../person.txt

      • createCompletedProjectFile

        public static void createCompletedProjectFile()
        This method creates an empty text file called CompletedProject.txt where all the Project object details are stored permanently, for projects that have been finalized.

        If the text file already exists, nothing is done. If the text file does not exist and cannot be created an error message is displays

        See Also:
        ../CompletedProject.txt

      • readInputAndSaveProjectArray

        public static java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> readInputAndSaveProjectArray()
        This method reads the project.txt file saves each line as an array entry in a String ArrayList.
        Returns:
        returns a String ArrayList with all the project detail lines in the text file as array entries.

      • readInputAndSavePersonArrayString

        public static java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> readInputAndSavePersonArrayString()
        This method reads the person.txt file saves each line as an array entry in a String ArrayList.
        Returns:
        returns a String ArrayList with all the person detail lines in the text file as array entries.

      • convertStringArrayListToProjectArray

        public static Project[] convertStringArrayListToProjectArray(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> allProjectsDetails)
        This method converts a String ArrayList to a Project Array.
        Parameters:
        allProjectsDetails - Project Array containing all the details of existing projects.
        Returns:
        returns the Project Array with all the existing Project object field values.

      • convertProjectArrayToStringArray

        public static java.lang.String[] convertProjectArrayToStringArray(Project[] allProjectDetailsArray)
        Converts a Project Array to a String Array, so that it can be written to the projects.txt text file.
        Parameters:
        allProjectDetailsArray - Project Array containing all the details of existing projects.
        Returns:
        returns a String Array with all the Project object details.

      • writeUpdatedInfoToProjectTextFile

        public static void writeUpdatedInfoToProjectTextFile(java.lang.String[] projectDetailsArray)
        This method writes project String Arrays to the projects.txt file.
        Parameters:
        projectDetailsArray - String Array containing all the details of existing projects.
        See Also:
        ../projects.txt

      • writeUpdatedInfoToPersonTextFile

        public static void writeUpdatedInfoToPersonTextFile(java.lang.String[] personDetailsToPrint)
        This method writes person String Arrays to the person.txt file.
        Parameters:
        personDetailsToPrint - String Array containing all the existing Person objects as strings.
        See Also:
        ../person.txt

      • writeUpdatedInfoToCompletedProjectTextFile

        public static void writeUpdatedInfoToCompletedProjectTextFile(java.lang.String[] completedProjectsArray)
        This method writes Project String Arrays to the CompletedProject.txt file.
        Parameters:
        completedProjectsArray - String Array containing all the existing Project objects that have been finalized.
        See Also:
        ../CompletedProject.txt

      • convertStringToPersonArray

        public static java.util.ArrayList<Person> convertStringToPersonArray(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> allPersonsDetailsString)
        This method converts a String ArrayList to a Person ArrayList.
        Parameters:
        allPersonsDetailsString - String Array containing all the existing Person objects as strings.
        Returns:
        returns a Person ArrayList with all Person objects.

      • convertPersonArrayToString

        public static java.lang.String[] convertPersonArrayToString(java.util.ArrayList<Person> allPersonsDetails)
        This method converts a Person ArrayList to a String Array so that it can be written to the person.txt file.
        Parameters:
        allPersonsDetails - Person ArrayList containing all the existing Person objects.
        Returns:
        returns the String Array with all the Person objects.
